text: Client drift in federated optimization can be reduced with proximal regularization and periodic full-precision anchor rounds when non-IID severity is high.
Deadline-aware client scheduling should prioritize stragglers with compressed updates so round completion remains stable under heterogeneous bandwidth.
Secure aggregation deployment needs key-rotation cadence, dropout-tolerant mask cancellation, and auditable incident response when aggregation windows fail.
Commodity CPU deployment benefits from bounded heap growth, deterministic inference latency targets, and explicit peak RSS reporting in every benchmark run.
Open governance cadence requires public decision logs, reproducible weekly artifacts, and contributor-facing milestone issue triage with ownership tags.
Communication efficiency improves when int8 quantization is paired with error feedback buffers, sparse top-k filtering, and periodic dense correction rounds.
Cohort readiness checks should enforce region diversity, hardware tier diversity, network tier diversity, and caps on unknown metadata fields.
Long-window pilot reporting must include uptime trends, fairness deltas, quality stability bands, communication savings, and checksum-backed provenance manifests.
